verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat king of Judah returned safely to his home in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him, and said to king Jehoshaphat, Shouldest thou help the ungodly, and love them that hate the LORD? therefore is wrath upon thee from before the LORD.
verses.ct: Jehu son of Hanani the prophet went out to meet him and said to King Jehoshaphat, "Should you really be helping wicked people and showing loyalty to those who hate the LORD? Because of this, the LORD's anger is directed at you."

verses.kjv: Nevertheless there are good things found in thee, in that thou hast taken away the groves out of the land, and hast prepared thine heart to seek God.
verses.ct: "Even so, there is some good in you, because you have removed the Asherah poles from the land and have set your heart on seeking God."

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem: and he went out again through the people from Beersheba to mount Ephraim, and brought them back unto the LORD God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat lived in Jerusalem, but he went out again among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim and brought them back to the LORD, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And he set judges in the land throughout all the fenced cities of Judah, city by city,
verses.ct: He appointed judges throughout the land in every fortified city of Judah, city by city.

verses.kjv: And said to the judges, Take heed what ye do: for ye judge not for man, but for the LORD, who is with you in the judgment.
verses.ct: He told the judges, "Be careful about what you do, because you are not making judgments on behalf of people — you are doing it on behalf of the LORD, and he is with you whenever you render a decision."

verses.kjv: Wherefore now let the fear of the LORD be upon you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with the LORD our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of gifts.
verses.ct: "So let deep reverence for the LORD guide you. Be careful and carry out your duties, because the LORD our God does not tolerate injustice, show favoritism, or accept bribes."

verses.kjv: Moreover in Jerusalem did Jehoshaphat set of the Levites, and of the priests, and of the chief of the fathers of Israel, for the judgment of the LORD, and for controversies, when they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: In Jerusalem as well, Jehoshaphat appointed some of the Levites, priests, and heads of Israelite families to serve as judges for cases involving the LORD's law and for disputes. Then they returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he charged them, saying, Thus shall ye do in the fear of the LORD, faithfully, and with a perfect heart.
verses.ct: He gave them these instructions: "This is how you must carry out your duties — with wholehearted dedication to the LORD, with faithfulness, and with complete integrity."

verses.kjv: And what cause soever shall come to you of your brethren that dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and judgments, ye shall even warn them that they trespass not against the LORD, and so wrath come upon you, and upon your brethren: this do, and ye shall not trespass.
verses.ct: "Whenever a case comes before you from your brothers living in their cities — whether it involves a killing, or questions about the law, commandments, regulations, or rulings — you must warn them not to sin against the LORD. Otherwise his anger will fall on both you and your brothers. Do this, and you will not be guilty of sin."

verses.kjv: And, behold, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of the LORD; and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, for all the king’s matters: also the Levites shall be officers before you. Deal courageously, and the LORD shall be with the good.
verses.ct: "Look, Amariah the chief priest has authority over you in all matters related to the LORD, and Zebadiah son of Ishmael, the leader of the tribe of Judah, handles all matters related to the king. The Levites will serve as officials to assist you. Act with courage, and the LORD will be with those who do what is right."
